1.text: At this also my heart trembles, and is moved out of his place.

2.text: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goes out of his mouth.

3.text: He directs it under the whole heaven, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a voice roars: he thunders with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

5.text: God thunders marvelously with his voice; great things does he, which we cannot comprehend.

6.text: For he said to the snow, Be you on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

7.text: He seals up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

8.text: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

9.text: Out of the south comes the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

10.text: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

11.text: Also by watering he wearies the thick cloud: he scatters his bright cloud:

12.text: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatever he commands them on the face of the world in the earth.

13.text: He causes it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

14.text: Listen to this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Do you know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

16.text: Do you know the balancing of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: How your garments are warm, when he quiets the earth by the south wind?

18.text: Have you with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

19.text: Teach us what we shall say to him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

21.text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passes, and cleans them.

22.text: Fair weather comes out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

23.text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

24.text: Men do therefore fear him: he respects not any that are wise of heart.
